words.definition: If someone acts accordingly, they act in a way that is suitable.
words.example: He feels like he did a good job, and his boss should pay him accordingly.

words.definition: An anchor is a heavy object dropped from a boat to make it stay in one place.
words.example: When the ship reached its destination, the crew dropped the anchor.

words.definition: A buoy is a floating sign that warns boats of dangerous areas.
words.example: Don't steer the boat near those buoys.

words.definition: A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage.
words.example: The earthquake was a terrible catastrophe for the city.

words.definition: Context is the situation that forms the setting for an event.
words.example: You need to understand the context of the story to grasp its meaning.

words.definition: To designate something means to give it a particular name or title.
words.example: The area was designated as a national park.

words.definition: To distort something means to change it so that it is no longer true.
words.example: The media distorted the truth about the event.

words.definition: A dock is a place where ships stop and people get on or off.
words.example: The ship was tied to the dock.

words.definition: The fore of something is the front part of it.
words.example: The fore of the ship was damaged in the storm.

words.definition: If something is frequent, it happens often.
words.example: We make frequent trips to the city to visit our friends.

words.definition: When something is genuine, it is real and not a copy.
words.example: She has a genuine interest in helping others.

words.definition: Grease is a thick substance used on machines to make them move smoothly.
words.example: The mechanic put some grease on the engine parts.

words.definition: When something is intricate, it has many small parts or details.
words.example: The watch has an intricate mechanism.

words.definition: To offset something means to use one thing to cancel out the effect of another thing.
words.example: The high cost of the hotel was offset by the low cost of the flight.

words.definition: To overlap means to cover part of the same area as something else.
words.example: The two maps overlap each other.

words.definition: To precipitate something means to cause it to happen suddenly or sooner than expected.
words.example: The crisis precipitated the collapse of the government.

words.definition: When something is secondhand, it has been owned by someone else before.
words.example: I bought a secondhand car to save money.

words.definition: A slot is a narrow opening in a machine or container.
words.example: He put a coin in the slot of the vending machine.

words.definition: To submerge something means to put it completely underwater.
words.example: The submarine submerged into the deep ocean.

words.definition: A tactic is a plan or method used to achieve a particular goal.
words.example: The team used a clever tactic to win the game.
